statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Southern Illinois 66, Saint Mary's 61
article.story: MORAGA, Calif. (AP) -- Randal Falker and Jamaal Tatum combined for 40 points and made big plays down the stretch to lead Southern Illinois to a 66-61 victory over Saint Mary's on Saturday. Tatum, who scored 17, responded immediately with baskets after Saint Mary's (6-8) took its only two leads in the game in the second half. After an Omar Samhan rebound gave Saint Mary's its first lead 40-39 with 11:25 to play, Tatum scored a basket for Southern Illinois (9-2). Wayne Hunter put Saint Mary's ahead for the second and final time 42-41, but Tatum hit a 3-pointer with 10:20 to play, and the Salukis never trailed again. Falker, who scored 23 and had 11 rebounds for his first double-double of the year, blocked Saint Mary's shots on the Gaels' next two possessions as Southern Illinois built its lead. Falker finished with five blocks. Saint Mary's cut the lead to one at 55-54 when Brett Collins converted a three-point play with 1:58 left. But Wesley Clemmons, who finished with 11, sank a 3-pointer from the corner on an assist by Tatum to start an eight-point Southern Illinois run. Falker scored five of Southern Illinois' first seven points to start the game and its first six points to start the second half. Hunter led Saint Mary's with 17 points. Diamon Simpson added 13 and Collins 10 for Saint Mary's, which lost its fourth straight, including road games at nationally ranked Nevada and Connecticut.
